meanings.definition: A joint formed by one or more tapered projections on one piece that interlock with corresponding notches or recesses in another.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully crafted a dovetail to join the wooden pieces securely.
meanings.sent2: The dovetail of the puzzle piece perfectly fit into the matching slot.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel cleverly hid its acorns in the dovetail of the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a dovetail, fitting together seamlessly despite their differences.
meanings.sent5: The key slid smoothly into the dovetail of the lock, securing the door.

meanings.definition: To fit together compactly or harmoniously.
meanings.sent1: The team members dovetail their skills to complete the project efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Her ideas and his suggestions dovetail perfectly in the business plan.
meanings.sent3: The music and the dance dovetail beautifully, creating a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent4: Their schedules dovetail so well that they never miss their weekly coffee dates.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting dovetail in a way that captivates the viewer's eye.
